definitions.definition: The act of regulating or the condition of being regulated .
A law or administrative rule , issued by an organization, used to guide or prescribe the conduct of members of that organization.
examples: Army regulations state a soldier AWOL over 30 days is a deserter.

definitions.definition: A type of law made by the executive branch of a government, usually as authorized by a statute made by the legislative branch giving the executive the authority to do so.

subdefinitions.definition: A numbered provision within such kind of legislation.
examples: Regulation 18B of the Defence (General) Regulations 1939 (S.R. & O. 1939/927) authorized the British government to intern suspected spies and collaborators during World War II .

definitions.definition: A form of legislative act which is self-effecting, and requires no further intervention by the Member States to become law.
Physiological process which consists in maintaining homoeostasis.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The act of regulating or the condition of being regulated .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A law or administrative rule , issued by an organization, used to guide or prescribe the conduct of members of that organization.

( law , often in the plural ) A type of law made by the executive branch of a government, usually as authorized by a statute made by the legislative branch giving the executive the authority to do so.
( European Union law ) A form of legislative act which is self-effecting, and requires no further intervention by the Member States to become law.
( medicine ) Physiological process which consists in maintaining homoeostasis.
